intro: Henckelia umbellata, commonly known as the white-flowered bell heather, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically leathery and dark green, and it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Henckelia umbellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
